reasoning: Reporting incidence of new osteoporotic fractures (hip, spine, wrist). Global estimate ~500 per 100k person-years based on IOF epidemiological data. Significant age and geographic variation.
source: Johnell O, Kanis JA. (2006). An estimate of the worldwide prevalence and disability associated with osteoporotic fractures. Osteoporos Int. 17(12):1726-33
